column11:
2018
Absolutely dreadful movie. Beautifully filmed with great fx - in fact possibly the best-looking Star Wars movie to date - but in every other way a pile of rubbish that desecrates the legacy and memory of a beloved franchise. I thought that the Force Awakens had already killed Star Wars and found it depressing; but this piece of incoherent tripe stomps on the grave and spits on the headstone - and it makes me angry.
'

Destroying the iconic character of Luke Skywalker!

I grew up with Luke Skywalker who saved his evil father out of compassion and fought for his friends. Only a shadow of this character is left in The Last Jedi. Instead we see a grumpy and angry old man who wants our new hero Rey to leave him alone. Fine so far
column34: if this changes over the course of this movie
column36: that is the Luke&Rey dynamic in this whole movie. No emotional and personal bonding. We learn what happened between Luke and Ben (his nephew) and in this Luke entered with an ignited weapon the room of his nephew because he sensed some darkness and had for an blink of an eye the idea to kill him. Yes
column37:
just throw the whole original Lucas trilogy out of the window for this. I call this lazy writing to make Kylo look better and a character assassination.

So we can follow Rey
column38: who should then be the eyes of the audience? Nope
column39: she acts stupid and listens to evil Kylo
column40: despite that this guy tortured her in the last movie and killed and injured her best friends. Rey also needs no training and like in the last movie
column41:
she just lest the force in and can do everything without training. Luke does not really train her and instead tells he why the Jedi should end and why he came to the island to die. Another big failure. Rey and Luke even fight and of course the Jedi master Luke is beaten by a not trained Rey...what a surprise.

We come to another big issue of this movie the slapstick Marvel humor entering Star Wars. Poe making a prank call to Hux
column42: Hux ridiculed by Snoke in front of the other First Order soldiers. Then we saw some of Luke\'s daily life and I wish I could get the scene out of my head with Luke milking this big pace creature for green milk. We also got a scene in which Luke wants to burn the temple tree after Rey was gone
column43: but cannot do it and then Yoda appears and shows him that he did not learn anything in 30 years

because Yoda is still the master and force lightning style burns the tree.

We also have some other characters in this movie like Finn and newbie Rose

The plot of Poe and Holdo as both competitors for military leadership was again a sign of bad writing and Holdo simply telling Poe about the rescue plan would have saved us the usleless Finn&Rose mission.

The last appearance of Luke
column47: after no one else came for rescue was another rollercoaster of bad writing
column48: bad execution and simply bad directing. It starts with a nice goodbye scene between Luke&Leia and so we expect a showdown between Luke and Kylo. Yes

**SPOILER FREE REVIEW**
I have now seen this film three times: with my younger brothers (11 & 14)
column68: with my parents (late 40s) and with my girlfriend (21). All of us loved it and it got better every viewing. The action was exciting
column70: the humour was funny (a lot of complaints about this
column71: I didn\'t find it to be the case at all)
column72:
and the story continued the journey well.

Many complaints are about Luke\'s character
column73: I found him to be engaging
column74: more so than the original trilogy in which he was relatively boring character-wise. He is different
column75:
but why is that a surprise considering all that has happened? All of the characters have been progressed and enriched by this film. The plot holes are easily explained and are no more significant than in any of the other films.

To conclude
column76: The Last Jedi was a thrilling ride from beginning to end
column77: moving the Star Wars universe forward in an unexpected
column79: direction. Everyone I\'ve spoken to loved it
column80: don\'t dwell too much on internet opinions. One minor qualm is that a subplot was extended dragged on slightly

column90:
2018
Wow. This was bad. Very bad. Have lost faith in Rotten Tomatoes. 90% from Top Critics!!!! You useless sell outs. Am I missing some irony in this? It must be tongue in cheek. Nobody could seriously put their reputation as a critic at such risk and say this is a good film. Did I read the title wrong? Was this actually a new Spaceballs film? Did Luke really milk that big breasted ocean monster? Did Chewy actually have a novelty fake rubber chicken on a skewer and Penguin owls manning the M Falcon? Hans would be shitting in his grave. I didn\'t know whether to laugh or cry so I shat myself too. I think they then used that to write and make the rest of the film while I went out to buy some \xa310 popcorn. WTF were those strange frog creatures on Lukes island? The offspring of Toad of Toad Hall and Mother Teresa. Yoda - what a disgrace. Luke - Bigger let down to the Jedi than this film was to the franchise. Rose - Glad you died. Snoke - Voldermort\'s now branching out. Kylo - What a lame sulky teenager. Needs a good spanking and bed without dinner. Rey - About the only thing that holds this shit together. Going to send Disney my newborns 200 shitty nappies as ideas for the next film. Perhaps they can make even more of a joke of it. I will still go see it though

God
column99:
the Star Wars fanbase sucks.

People love using buzzwords like "SJW propaganda" and "Mary Sue" as replacements for "there are primary characters who aren\'t white" and "the lead character is a girl."

People like focusing on this trivial shit instead of the actual story
column100: which is really telling of how stupid and childish the fans of these movies are. In this case
column101: the story was just okay. It\'s wierdly paced
column102:
and Finn and Rose\'s story ends up being a total waste of time. That whole bit added an extra half-hour that could have been used for something better (or taken out entirely).

Another buzzword people like using is the word "plothole
column103: which is really obnoxious to have to see used incorrectly every three sentences when reading through these already terrible and egregiously misinformed audience reviews. People seem to think a plothole is a thing that didn\'t make sense to me
column104:
or a small bit of minutiae that doesn\'t add up with something else but has no affect on the story as a whole."

In real life
column107: a loose end that is never tied up by the end of the film
column109: trilogy of films. The Last Jedi
column110: as far as I can remember
column111:
doesn\'t contain any.

As for the stupid political argument...

Star Wars has always been left-leaning. There\'s no getting around that. It\'s always been about taking down a fascist institution. That\'s as left-leaning as you can get. But
column113: people act like the political angle of Star Wars is somehow...a new thing? But it\'s not the actual political element of the Story that people focus on. Oh no
column114: the part that theyre focusing on is the fact that the three protagonists are a white woman
column117: instead of two white men and a white woman. They will deny that this is the problem
column118:
saying that it is instead the fact that "they are thrown in" or "there\'s no good reason for it."

Guaranteed
column119: the people saying these things are white men who don\'t like seeing women and people of color in positions of power
column120: and upon seeing it will denounce it as "pandering to liberals" despite the fact that Star Wars
column122:
has been a condemnation of far conservative ideals.

As it stands
column123:
The Last Jedi is nowhere close to being the best Star Wars movie. It\'s a reasonably satisfying Star Wars movie. It\'s about as good as Return of the Jedi.

If you dislike this movie because of the wierd pacing
column124: or how most things that happen end up being totally ineffectual
column126: that\'s perfectly valid. Those are actual issues. But if you don\'t like it because it\'s "SJW bullshit" or whatever madness is going on inside your head then kindly fuck off. ']
